snippet: Under the agreement, which must be passed by the Legislature and signed by the governor, fantasy sports companies would pay the state 15 percent of net revenue.
abstract: John J Bonacic, chairman of the New York Senate’s gambling committee, says legislators have drafted bill to legalize daily fantasy sports; bill would quell ongoing legal dispute over online games but must be passed by both Legislative houses and be signed by Gov Andrew Cuomo.
lead_paragraph: Under the agreement, which must be passed by the Legislature and signed by the governor, fantasy sports companies would pay the state 15 percent of net revenue.

headline.main: Committee in Albany Reaches Deal to Legalize Daily Fantasy Sports
headline.print_headline: Legislators Reach Deal to Legalize Daily Fantasy Sports
